lines.text: Those who are tardy do not get fruit cup.
[Credits and title music end as Thorndyke exits the airport]
What a dramatic airport.
[attempting to lift a heavy suitcase]
I got it. I got it. I got it.
[thump]
I ain't got it.
Professor Little Old Man.
"Lillolman". "Lillolman".
What's your sign?
I'm sorry. It's... unlisted.
Do you really think this is nessa...?
Of course it's nessa!
[after an attack by the bellboy]
That kid gets no tip.
Enjoy yourself, for God's sake! Get your mind off the Wentworth murder... Accident! Accident!

[bursting into Thorndyke's room]
Get away from the door!
[begins wheezing as if out of breath]
Who are you?
Get away from me.
Just a second...
[she cuts him off]
Be quiet, they'll hear you. Don't move. Go inside. Go to your room.
[they enter the living room]
The drapes! Close the drapes!
The drapes. Close the drapes.
[Repeating, to himself]
Close the drapes.
Close the other one. Get down! Lower! Good. Quick, come here. Get up. Sit down. Not there, here.
Here?
There.
I'm sorry, please forgive me. I'm just *so* close to my menstrual cycle that I could scream!
You want to x-ray the celery? What do you think we're smuggling dope in the celery? The celery's not for dope. It's for dip!
How did you, ummmm... get my room number? I am not going to listen to any more of this, I mean, I've had just about enough! What are you wearing? Jeans? You're wearing jeans? I bet they're tight.
Have you seen my father at the Institute? Is he all right?
He's fine, he's fine. He's coming along just fine. He's very affectionate. He licked me.
He what?
Well, he thinks he's a dog these days.
A dog?
A dog, yes.
Do you mind if I smoke?

[sets off alarm while going through airport security in disguise carrying a gun]
What is this, a game show? What did I win, a Pinto?
I'm sorry sir, we're going to have to search you.
Please sir, what did I do? What did I do? What's my crime?
You beeped.
I beeped! I beeped! Take me away! Take me back to Russia! Put me in irons! I beeped! The mad beeper is loose! Take away the beeper! Take me away!
Come to my room right after dinner.
No, not tonight. I'm too tired. I think I'll turn in early.
I'll let you wear my underwear.
I'll be there.
Rate of patient recovery? I'll have that for you in a moment.
[taps on his calculator]
Once in a blue moon.
Once in a blue moon. Hmm.

As I was saying, it came to my attention that just before Dr. Ashley's untimely death, he was planning to make some very big changes here at the institute. Do any of you know specifically what those changes might be?
Well, for one thing, he wanted to change...
The drapes.
The drapes?
The drapes. He wanted to change the drapes in the Psychotic Game Room.
That was the extent of the big change, the... drapes?
Oh, yes. Dr. Ashley felt that color has a great deal to do with the well-being of the emotionally disturbed.

[on the phone]
I don't know what they said; I only know that they met. What do you want me to do, kill 'em? if you want me to kill 'em, I'll kill 'em. I don't have to kill 'em, but I'd like to kill 'em... I killed Ashley Wentworth; another killing or two won't make a difference... It would make me happy... I'd like to kill 'em both... I think it'd be better if I kill 'em both... Well, let me kill just one then... Whichever one you want... Alright, I'll wait. But the minute you say kill 'em, I'll kill 'em. I'll love to kill 'em. It would give me immense pleasure.
Perhaps I've been a bit too haaaarsh...
Listen, mister, I don't go for this sort of thing.
Another one? Listen, Richard, you have got to get a grip on yourself.

[ripping duct tape off Brophy's mouth]
Where is Brisbane?
They took him to
[screams]
Working? Hmm, working. Working is a big word. I'm a consultant. It's a fancy title for a part-time job.
Oh, get off it. I know you better than you know yourself. You live for bondage and discipline!

[moaning]
Too much bondage. Too much bondage. Not enough discipline!
Ahem!
Oh, allow me to introduce Nurse Diesel, my right-hand man, woman.

[after having had a panic attack in Professor Lillolman's office]
Thank you, thank you Professor. I'm sorry, I don't know what came over me.
High Anxiety. You've still got it!
It's probably the excitement and tension of taking over this new post. I'm... sure it will pass.

[Leans in close to Thorndyke's face]
Bullshit! These things do not let go. High Anxiety can be a very dangerous enemy! If left unchecked, it could cost you your LIFE!

[Pointing to his nametag]
Dr. Richard H. Thorndyke... What does the 'H' stand for?
[Puts his hand over his mouth and indistinctly mumbles something]

[Not understanding]
What?

[Now speaking clearly]
Harpo... My mother loved the Marx Brothers. She saw all their movies. She named me Harpo.
Harpo? Harpo... I like it. You know, it's very refreshing. I mean, there are certain names that you just don't hear very often these days.
We've got to destroy the negative. Give us the negative, Brophy.

[Stubbornly defiant]
You'll never get it. Never. Never! Do you hear me? You'll never get this! I'd rather DIE first!
Norton?
[Approaches Brophy, pulls out a .45, cocks it, and sticks it up to Brophy's forehead]

[Meekly, as he immediately hands over the negative]
Here.

[Talking to Dr. Thorndyke while Thorndyke is having a panic attack on the stairs]
Richard! Richard, listen to me... I have researched your case. I know what is giving you the High Anxiety. I have found the answer. Go back in your mind. Go back. Go back! You are a little baby. Your mother and father are fighting. They are always fighting! They are fighting about YOU!

[after a childhood flashback reveals the truth to him]
I understand now. I understand now! It's not heights I'm afraid of... it's PARENTS!
Ja. Ja! Now climb, you son of a bitch! CLIMB!
[Dr. Thorndyke brushes his teeth]

[starts off slow]
Up and down. Up and down. Side, side, side, side, side. In and out. In and out. Side, side, side, side, side.
[quicker, now]
Up and down. Up and down. Side, side, side, side, side. In and out. In and out.
[very deliberate for the finish]
Side, side, side, side, side.
And remember, folks. Be good to your parents. They were good to you.
Don't be so gauche. We're all doing it!
This is not the man I met at the institute. Something is very... very... wrong.
Forgive me for prying. But, what happened to your mustache?
Well, as you know, things can get a bit dicey on this wing. On day, I wasn't on my toes and one of the patients reached out and tore off ½ of my mustache.
That must have been awful!

[very flatly]
You will never know the pain.

[quizzing Dr. Thorndyke]
A patient comes into your office suffering from Belldon's Hysteria, and he has a seizure right in your office, what do you give him?
2 cc's of aqueous Thorazine coupled with Somadiozine!
I'm trapped! I feel like I'm caught in a web!
Gosh, you're fickle!
My name is Victoria Brisbane, my father is Arthur Brisbane.
